intro: Nestlera acaenoides, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed nestlera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in umbrella-like clusters. Native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile, it thrives in dry, temperate climates. The plant has pinnately compound leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the carrot family.
